markings: Undeciphered seal in the lower right corner
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e), ink and color on paper with embossing
provenance: Raymond Koechlin (2nd Vignier & Inada 1911, no. 36; until ca. 1931); Louis V. Ledoux (at least 1931-48); Roland Koscherak (around 1948); Richard P. Gale (until 1974)
text:
Calender print of the year Meiwa 2 (1765) with the numbers for the long months on the side of the bridge.
Relating to a famous poem of Teika: {Koma tomete / Sode uchi harau / Kage mo nashi / Sano no watari no / Yuki no yūgure} (There's no place to stop my horse / Where I can brush snow off / From my sleeves underneath / In the snowy evening / On the bridge at Sano.)
title: Visual Parody of Fujiwara no Teika's Poem Crossing the Sano
